meanings.definition: A person or machine that stamps.
meanings.sent1: The stamper at the post office put the stamp on my letter.
meanings.sent2: I used the stamper to mark my books with my name.
meanings.sent3: The stamper in the factory never gets tired of stamping all day.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a stamper, leaving an impression on everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The stamper's rhythmic sound echoed through the room, marking each document with authority.

meanings.sent1: Dad handed me the stamper to mark the boxes.
meanings.sent2: The stamper made it easy to put my name on all my belongings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the stamper and left ink pawprints everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a stamper, leaving a lasting impression on my heart.
meanings.sent5: The shiny stamper gleamed in the sunlight, ready to mark any paper that came its way.

meanings.definition: A device used to impress a design or mark onto a surface.
meanings.sent1: The stamper embossed the logo onto the leather wallet.
meanings.sent2: I bought a new stamper to decorate my scrapbook.
meanings.sent3: The stamper at the art store had a quirky personality, always adding a unique touch to each design.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a stamper, leaving a bright mark on everyone he met.
meanings.sent5: The stamper's intricate patterns transformed plain paper into works of art with a single press.
